qas.question: Who sent armies across the Pruth River?
Who commanded the armies across the Pruth River?

answers.text: Field Marshal Ivan Paskevich and General Mikhail Gorchakov

qas.question: Who was in control of the Danubian Principalities?
In what year did Russian soldiers cross the Pruth River?
How did most Russians die when crossing the Pruth River?

context: Shortly after he learned of the failure of Menshikov's diplomacy toward the end of June 1853, <a0_0>the Tsar<a0_0/> sent armies under the commands of <a1_0>Field Marshal Ivan Paskevich and General Mikhail Gorchakov<a1_0/> across the Pruth River into the <a2_0>Ottoman<a2_0/>-controlled Danubian Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia. Fewer than half of the 80,000 Russian soldiers who crossed the Pruth in <a3_0>1853<a3_0/> survived. By far, most of the deaths would result from <a4_0>sickness<a4_0/> rather than combat,:118–119 for the Russian army still suffered from medical services that ranged from bad to none.
